textList.name: TEXT_FILLER_FREE
textList.text: You arrive in a system and immediately discover a pirate ship nearby. Strangely, scans indicate there are no lifeforms aboard. You salvage anything useful, but find no clue as to the whereabouts of the former crew.
Not much remains in this abandoned system; however, scans reveal a nearby mining platform with some salvageable materials.
As you arrive in the system you are hailed by a loyalist settlement. Upon learning of your quest, they offer you supplies.
Debris from a forgotten battle still orbits the gas giant in this system. Some of it still might be usable.

You receive a message from a nearby station, "A Federation cruiser jumping into Rebel territory? Quite the bold move." You quickly move to arm the weapons but he continues, "Lucky for you we're not all in support of the Rebellion. Perhaps these supplies will help you get to friendlier space alive."
You happen upon the remains of a space station. It has been mostly picked clean but there appears to be a few materials that will aid you in your mission.

textList.name: TEXT_FILLER_DRONE
textList.text: When you ask a nearby station for aid, a friendly programmer gives you the schematics for a drone!
An abandoned space station circles a lonely planet. A quick check yields schematics for a drone. You bring it aboard the ship.
Federation sympathizers contact you as you arrive. "We know your mission should be secret, so don't ask how we know about it. Take this schematic, it's all we can do to help."

A small Engi research vessel is trying to fend off a Mantis ship. You move in to engage, but after a quick scan of your ship the Mantis ship retreats. The Engi offer you a drone schematic as thanks for your timely arrival.
You find an abandoned mining station on a nearby moon. A quick scan shows no life forms; however, you discover a usable drone schematic!
You receive a wide-band message, "Free schematic samples! Be sure to visit our new military-grade drone store opening in sector XR1-45!"

textList.name: TEXT_FILLER_WEAPON
textList.text: Holy crap! A weapon is just floating in space!
You inform a nearby station of your flight from the Rebels. They offer to outfit your ship with a weapon and wish you well.
A settlement still loyal to the Federation hails your ship. They have prepared a weapon to aid your escape from the Rebels.
As soon as you arrive a small Mantis ship detaches from a wreck and jumps away. You must have interrupted their salvage operation because you find a weapon ready to be installed!
A small merchant ship messages you, "Underground Federation comm channels are all talking about your 'secret' mission. Let us install a weapon to help. Good luck!"
Debris from a battle is scattered around this system. A few pieces bounce against your ship. You passively scan them and discover there is a functioning weapon among them!

event.name: FILLER_SIGNAL
event.text: A Federation encrypted signal is being broadcast from a nearby planet.

choice.text: Send an away party to investigate.
It could be a trap. Let's move on.

event.text: You decide not to risk anything.
You find a small cache of supplies that were surely left for any loyal Federation ships in trouble. You take all that you need, leaving some for others to find.
As you approach the signal you receive a message on a Rebel channel, "I knew we'd catch some Federation fish with this signal. Prepare to be boarded, scum!"

event.name: FILLER_EQUINOID
event.text: Scanners are showing intelligent life forms on a nearby planet. No match for them can be found in the database.
You land a small shuttle in an enormous field, whose only occupants are small, brightly colored, six-legged, horse-like animals. Could they be what your scans picked up?

choice.text: Bring some of the creatures on board to sell.

event.text: This isn't the time for exobiology. You head back to the ship.

choice.text: (Nights) "Oi, lisssten up you freakin' horssse thingsss!"

event.text: Nights drunkenly stumbles forwards, shouting at the horses randomly. This scares them away, but fortunately you follow them back to the location of a crash site where you find a barely alive Engi Defender and a lot of scrap. Nights might be a hungover idiot, but at least he accidentally brings you into a lot of beneficial situations.

After a moment, your crew tells you that these are simple beings, who enjoy a peaceful life. Your Slug puts the horse into a calm state, and you even manage to bring back a specimen. Without any fear of the horses, you explore further and even find old wreckage on the planet of an Engi ship, though the inhabitant is dead.

After a moment, your crew tells you that these are simple beings, who enjoy a peaceful life. Your Shell puts the horse into a calm state, and you even manage to bring back a specimen. Without any fear of the horses, you explore further and even find old wreckage on the planet of an Engi ship, though the inhabitant is dead.

choice.text: (Jerry) Jerry wants to pet a horse.

event.text: You shrug and let Jerry go. To your surprise, he returns in the shuttle with one of the horses with him. Who the hell even is this guy?

choice.text: (Crystal Equinoid) Let your Equinoid freely roam.

event.text: You drop your Equinoid off on the planet. Though clearly different to the other Equinoids, it gets along perfectly fine with them. When it eventually returns to your ship, it is accompanied by another Equinoid. Seems it found a mate by pure chance.

You land your ship near one of the herds and let them roam around. Unfortunately, they scare off the other horses. Dismayed, your Cyberpony roams around regardless, and soon finds a well obscured crashed Engi ship. Inside is a Separatist, and they seem more than pleased to have a way off this planet.

choice.text: (Tamed Equinoid) Let your Equinoid freely roam.
(Untamed Equinoid) Let your Equinoid freely roam.

event.text: You drop your Equinoid off on the planet, and it eventually mingles with the rest of the herd. Unfortunately, you're not able to call it back. What were you expecting to happen?

removeCrew.text: Your Equinoid is not dead, and thus cannot legally be cloned. Assuming cloning regulations extend to non-sapient life forms.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Pacify the ponies and steal one.

event.text: Under the effects of the mind control the pony does nothing to resist you, allowing you to collect it with little difficulty.

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) Pacify the ponies and steal one.

event.text: Under the effects of the mind control weapon the pony does nothing to resist you, allowing you to collect it with little difficulty.
You ignore the readings and prepare to move on.

None of your attempts to communicate seem to work: they just stare at you silently. As you prepare to leave, one of the creatures canters forward and forcefully nudges you away from the ship. He seems to want you to follow him. Eventually, they guide you to an old Engi ship's crash site. Inside you are able to find and reactivate an Engi!
You try to communicate in every possible way you can but the equinoids just stand there, silently judging you with their large, expressionless eyes. You prepare to leave.

You drop your Equinoid off on the planet, and it eventually mingles with the rest of the herd. When it returns to you after cantering for a while, another Equinoid is accompanying it. Seems it just found a mate by pure chance.

You drop your Equinoid off on the planet, and it eventually mingles with the rest of the herd. After an uneventful while, you eventually call it back. You spend some time pondering what you expected to happen before eventually setting off.

event.name: FILLER_EQUINOID_SELL
event.text: The seemingly docile creatures quickly turn violent when you show your hostile intentions. They stampede with terrifying force, charging the ship before you have time to react.

event.name: FILLER_SICK
event.text: You arrive to find a small research station putting out a distress signal. There is no response to your hails.

choice.text: Dock with the station and investigate.
You cannot risk going in alone.

event.text: It's not worth risking your crew like this.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Use a drone to investigate.

event.text: The logs show that a number of the crew on this station died from the effects of a parasite that caused cannibalistic notions in the human mind. Knowing it is far too risky to enter, you stick to salvaging the exterior.

Sensors show scattered signs of life although most of the crew are deceased. However the health signatures of the living indicate they are violent and unstable. You decide it's better to move on than risk engaging the remaining crew.

There are no life signs detected on the ship although there appears to be a number of deceased crew. There does not appear to be any airborn contagions so your crew quickly salvages what they can before moving on. You can only wonder what befell the station.
Inside there are signs of a great struggle; scientists lie dead where they fell, brutally dismembered. You grab a few research drone parts lying on a desk near the door and leave quickly.

You dock with the station and see a frantic person banging on the airlock door. Once inside your ship, he drops to the floor saying, "My... friends... They've gone insane... They're coming!" You hand him a blaster and turn to see a number of people charging toward the ship.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Have the Advanced Medbay analyze their condition.

event.text: You hold them off while retreating into the Med-bay. Its advanced systems determine that an alien neurotoxin is the cause of their frenzy. It synthesizes an antidote and releases it into the room. After a time, the scientists recover. One offers their services as thanks for saving them.

As you explore the base, crazed screams are heard. Your team retreats back to your ship with a number of armed scientists in pursuit. One of your team starts to cough and falls in a spasm onto the floor.

choice.text: Drag him back to the ship and prepare for a fight.

event.text: As you get back on board, your injured friend rises up and starts to attack you, screaming. Caught off-guard, your remaining crew fall back as the other scientists fight their way onto the ship.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Use your Teleporter to retrieve your crew.

event.text: You beam your away team back to the ship and disengage from the station. Although the ship is safe, the infected crewmember quickly becomes frenzied and attacks.

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Drag him back to the Medbay.

event.text: You hold him down and the Medbay is able to stop whatever neurotoxin was on the ship from fully infecting your crew. Once he recovers, you prepare to fight off the scientists, who are beyond help.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Have the Advanced Medbay analyze their condition.

event.text: You hold them off while retreating into the Med-bay. Its advanced systems determine that an alien neurotoxin is driving your crewmember insane. It synthesizes an antidote and releases it into the ship. After a time, the frenzied scientists recover and one offers to help out as thanks for saving them.

You send your drone to explore the station. What you find is disconcerting... It appears that something has caused the scientists and guards to tear each other to pieces. You abandon the drone on the station for fear that it is contagious.

Once on board the station, your drone is immediately beset by frenzied scientists and guards. It eventually gets torn apart by the mob but it has bought you enough time to disengage from the station and escape into empty space.

The cameras mounted to your drone show a chaotic scene. No people are to be found but the remnants of a recent battle onboard the ship are obvious. You instruct the drone to retrieve some useful materials before leaving.

event.name: FILLER_PLAGUE
event.text: You arrive near a damaged and dilapidated space station. It appears to be abandoned but you detect faint life signatures on board.

choice.text: Board the station and look for survivors.
The AI advises against boarding without any reinforcements aboard your ship.

event.text: While waiting for the FTL drive to charge, you skirt around the edge of the station and collect some scrap.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Your Slug senses lifeforms aboard the ship, none of them look promising.

event.text: Following your Slug's advice, you decide to avoid the station. While waiting for the FTL drive to charge, you skirt around the edge of the station and collect some scrap.

choice.text: (Telepathic Shell) Your Shell senses lifeforms aboard the ship, none of them look promising.

event.text: Following your Shell's advice, you decide to avoid the station. While waiting for the FTL drive to charge, you skirt around the edge of the station and collect some scrap.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanners) Run scans on the station.

event.text: Scans show quite the depressing scene inside. Most of the crew are already dead, and they show signs of disease. It's best not to go anywhere near the station, and just scrap the hull instead.

Human corpses are scattered across the station. You find the source of the signal, a lone survivor that locked themselves in a storage closet. They desperately cling onto your drone while sobbing. Knowing what a traumatic experience it must have been, you run some evaluations but ultimately decide they're stable enough to be of help. You quickly retreat with them in tow back to the ship, and hope they can recover enough to be of some use.
All around you is the stench of death and decay. The life sign readings must have been malfunctioning because you really doubt anything could be alive in here. You quickly return to the ship.

Human corpses are scattered across the station. You find the source of the signal, a lone survivor that locked themselves in a storage closet. You quickly retreat with them in tow back to the ship, and hope they can recover enough to be of some use.

All around you is the stench of death and decay. Suddenly, one of your crew bends over and starts retching violently. Some sort of disease must have wiped out this station. You pull back to the ship, but it looks like your crewmember is not going to make it.
Your crewmember insists you leave them behind, not wanting to endanger the rest of the crew. Knowing the truth of this, you hurry back to the ship.

removeCrew.text: You stop your crew's clone from forming, knowing that the disease would follow into his next life.

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Try to cure the disease.

event.text: Your advanced medical suite is able to isolate the cause of the problem and administer an antidote. That was a close one.
You decide you need what supplies you have.

textList.name: TEXT_FILLER_UPGRADES
textList.text: "You look like a military vessel. We're trying to get back to our homes alive. I'm an engineer by trade and could try to improve your reactor if you have any extra supplies."
You receive a message from a small convoy. They're looking for some military supplies and are offering to try to improve your reactor in exchange.

event.text: You make the exchange and their team comes on board to try to improve your reactor.
You make the exchange and their team comes on board to try to improve your reactor.
You make the exchange and their team comes on board to try to improve your reactor.

event.name: FILLER_EXPLORE
event.text: Scans reveal a large asteroid field nearby. Short-range scanners may discover useful materials while we wait for the FTL to recharge.

choice.text: Too dangerous. We'll just wait for the FTL to charge.

event.text: You move on from the asteroid field.

choice.text: (Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: Your magnetic arm is not well suited to the task, but it is able to salvage a very small portion of space junk drifting around nearby.

choice.text: (Mining Equipment) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Attempt to mine the asteroids. [-1|]

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest.
Scans reveal a number of asteroids with useful compositions. You extract some fuel.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.
A pirate ship hiding behind one of the larger asteroids attacks you!

event.name: FILLER_SELL_DRONES
event.text: You see a Union space station with heavy damage. You receive a message, "We've been hit hard by the war. We need more drone parts to speed up our repairs. We'll buy some from you if you have extra."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
You have no need for the station's services.
The station is surprised by your sudden hostility, but prepares to defend themselves.

event.name: FILLER_SELL_MISSILES
event.text: There is a black market hub here. You receive a message, "These are dangerous times. If you have extra military-grade explosives, we'll gladly pay you for them."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
"Thank you, this will help greatly."
You have no need for the station's services.
The station is surprised by your sudden hostility, but prepares to defend themselves.
You decide you have nothing you want to trade.
The ship is shocked at your sudden offense. It readies what little defense it's equipped with.

textList.name: TRADER_CIV
textList.text: You arrive at a quiet spaceport and are immediately hailed by another ship at port with a "once in a lifetime deal!"
You jump into a sector filled with civilian activity. Your scan the various advertisement channels while waiting for your FTL to charge, and are intrigued by a grey-market shipwright.
Your ship is flooded with advertisement transmissions from nearby merchants as soon as you arrive at this beacon. You arbitrarily pick one to examine in detail.
Despite the barren area, a trader has set up shop at this beacon. He presents his offer.
The beacon at first glance seems home to a junk yard. Upon closer inspection, it reveals itself to be a ramshackle market. One trader has a deal that catches your eye.
A pawn broker has set up shop at this obscure beacon. He might be offering something worth looking at.

event.text: A nearby space station hails you. "Greetings! Your arrival is most fortuitous. We recently came across some extra drones. If you have some fuel, perhaps we can make a deal?"
You decline and end comms with the station.
You prepare for combat.
A strange vessel approaches. A digital message appears on your view-screen: "This is an automated merchant. Refill this vessel with fuel and it will supply you with drones."
You decline and end comms.
You prepare for combat.
You arrive in the sector and are greeted by a science vessel waiting by the beacon. They hail you, "We find ourselves low on fuel and have a proposition."
You decline and end comms.
You attack the Zoltan ship.

event.name: FILLER_REFUEL
event.text: A ship refueling station is stationed at this beacon. We can purchase fuel here.
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
"Thank you for your business."
You have no need for their services.
The station is surprised by your sudden hostility, but prepares to defend itself.

event.name: FILLER_REPAIR
event.text: You see a small station fitted with hundreds of Repair drones. You receive an automated message, "We don't know who you are and we don't care, but this is the right place for some ship repair!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
"Thank you for your business, no refunds!"
You have no need for the station's services.
The Auto-station wastes no time powering up its defenses.

event.name: FILLER_SOLARWRECK
event.text: The charred remains of a ship well beyond recognition drifts near the sun at this beacon. It won't be long until the strong gravitational pull of the star pulls it in, but there might be enough time for you to salvage a chunk of it.

choice.text: (Hull Armor) We can approach with little risk.
Ignore the wreck, the sun is enough to deal with.

event.text: Up close it's easier to tell that the ship was once an Engi vessel. One of their drones is still in good enough condition that you can scan it for a functional schematic.
It turns out most of the supplies onboard were destroyed, the fuel having burned up and the ammunition having exploded. You scrap off what little scrap you can from the exterior.
Miraculously, you find a living Rockman onboard, who survived the solar flares and kept the life support functional long enough to receive help. You bring them onboard your ship.
There is far less worth salvaging on the wreck than expected.
You jump when the ship powers up, revealing itself to be a still functional Rock vessel. They're furious you tried to scrap their ship while they were still aboard, and attack.
Up close it's easier to tell that the ship was once an Engi vessel. One of their drones is still in good enough condition that you can scan it for a functional schematic.
It turns out most of the supplies onboard were destroyed, the fuel having burned up and the ammunition having exploded. You scrap off what little scrap you can from the exterior.
Miraculously, you find a living Rockman onboard, who survived the solar flares and kept the life support functional long enough to receive help. You bring them onboard your ship.
There is far less worth salvaging on the wreck than expected.
You jump when the ship powers up, revealing itself to be a still functional Rock vessel. They're furious you tried to scrap their ship while they were still aboard, and attack.
Luckily you're able to get away from the wreckage before a solar flare can hit your ship. Now all you must do is wait for the FTL drive to charge.
Unfortunately, your salvage mission took too long, and a brutal solar flare hits your ship.
You ignore the crew.

textList.name: TAVERN_HIRE_TEXT
textList.text: You find a space station set up for travelers. Browsing through its listings, you find a tavern full of mercenaries for hire. You look for potential crewmembers.
There are a number of ships stationed around a rest stop. You immediately receive a message saying, "If you're looking for some bodies to fill your ship, you've come to the right place!"
This beacon seems to serve as a meeting place for local traffic. It seems you can find crew willing to fight on your ship here... for a price.

event.name: FILLER_HELP_MINERS
event.text: You come across an asteroid mining colony. They message you immediately, saying, "Greetings. Our supplies of mining explosives have run out ever since the Rebels blockaded this system. Do you have any extra explosives?"

choice.text: (Explosive Replicator) Use the replicator to synthesize the missiles for them.
(Missile Weapon) Offer to blast through the mine with your Launcher.

event.text: "I don't think you quite understand. I understand your... enthusiasm... but it's not exactly 'union friendly' to use military ballistic weapons in mining operations. Perhaps it's best we don't make any trades..."

choice.text: (Bomb Weapon) Offer to solve their problem by using a controlled explosion from your bomb. [-1}]

event.text: "Curious. I did not consider the practicality of using a bomb for such matters. I suppose it should be safe enough. You have my permission."

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) Offer to teach them how to construct makeshift explosives.

event.text: Your commando, being both an experienced arsonist and knowledgeable in the ways of explosives, explains to the miners how the Lost Suns have been using "recycled" ammunition to save costs. Thoroughly impressed by this knowledge, the colony's leader grants you access to some of their latest spoils.
"I understand. Good luck out there. We'll try to make do with what we have."
They thank you for your generosity and offer some scrap in exchange.
They thank you and offer to have their engineers repair some of your ship's hull.
They thank you and offer to have their engineers try to upgrade your reactor.
"Wow. This will help our efforts considerably. Let me see what I can scrounge up to offer you." They deliver some scrap and have their team try to repair part of your hull.
"Wow. This will help our efforts considerably." They offer to have their engineers fix up your ship and upgrade your reactor.
"Wow. This will help our efforts considerably. What could I offer for your troubles..." After some time they deliver a ship Augment for installation on your ship.
They thank you for your generosity and offer some scrap in exchange.
They thank you and offer to have their engineers repair some of your ship's hull.
They thank you and offer to have their engineers try to upgrade your reactor.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Use your Sensors to scan the wreckage.

event.text: You scan the battlefield, and with the aid of your Sensors, you are able to salvage a moderate amount of material from the wreckage. You prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Use your Sensors to scan the wreckage.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Use your Sensors to scan the wreckage.
Ignore the wreckage and continue on.

event.text: You ignore the wreckage.

textList.name: FILLER_WRECKAGE_TEXT
textList.text: What at first seems to be a simple nebula is actually filled with a good amount of debris from a brutal exchange between several ships. Wreckage drifts by your screens and tumbles into the depths of the nebula to be lost to sight. It's hard to determine who the combatants were without closer investigation.

You have jumped into the aftermath of what seems to have been a brutal exchange between several ships. Wreckage drifts by your screens, and you can still see the remains of the dying ships sparking and breaking apart. It's hard to determine who the combatants were without closer investigation.

event.text: You scan the battlefield, and with the aid of your Sensors, you are able to salvage a good amount of material from the wreckage. Well-stocked, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield and find a prototype military vessel in the debris! The crew has been killed, but their working prototype weapon array is still intact! You salvage it and bring it aboard.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and are able to salvage some useful material from the wreckage.
You scan the battlefield, and are able to salvage some useful material from the wreckage.
As you approach the wreckage, a Mantis ship screams into the system... either sensing prey - or to finish the job its fellows started.

The wreckage appears to be a battle between Federation fighters and Rebel cruisers. Though outnumbered, it looks like the Federation fought valiantly. As you begin a more detailed scan of the wreckage, Rebel reinforcements arrive in the system and target your ship!
As you approach the wreckage, a Zoltan ship makes its arrival. It immediately mistakes you for one of the attackers, declares you as hostile aggressors in violation of Zoltan space, and opens fire!
As you approach the wreckage, a Coalition vessel nearby activates! It seems the ship was aptly positioned inside the field of wreckage to spy on Federation ships like yours!

As you approach the wreckage, a Slug ship makes its arrival. It hesitates for a moment, as if surprised to see anyone remaining, and then jumps away without a word. You resume scanning the system, wary of any other visitors.

textList.name: FILLER_TERRAFORMING_SCAN_TEXT
textList.text: You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team C12 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team F17 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team A50-3 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team Z9 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team T6 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team R11 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team W8-2 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"

event.text: "Thank you! We need to scan this planet for life before we can begin terraforming, but our sensors can't get the necessary power to scan through this atmosphere. We've got a schedule to keep, any chance you can help?"

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Set sensors to maximum and scan.
(Bonus Power Crew) Send your crewman to overcharge their systems.
(Osmian Crew) Generate a hologram to overcharge their systems.
(Slug Crew) Check if your Slug senses any presence.
(Telepathic Shell) Check if your Shell senses any presence.

event.text: "We understand. Best of luck on your mission, sir!"
It seems your sensors are no more powerful than the terraformer's. You apologize and continue on your way.
You find if you modulate the feedback signal of your sensors to just the right frequency, you're able to get through the atmosphere and perform a complete scan!

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as thanks.

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your reactor as thanks.

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks, it's a pirate!

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks - seems like it was a Duskbringer fugitive!
A complete scan of the planet reveals a simple mold as the only life present. The terraformers claim their terraforming plans are only hindered by intelligent life; they can begin their work.

choice.text: Tell them to stop. Any life is valuable.

event.text: "But our livelihood depends on this job! Who cares about some silly mold? We'll pay you to look the other way!"

choice.text: Offer to pay them to at least delay until the mold can be studied.

event.text: They see reason and accept the offer. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as an apology for their behaviour.

choice.text: Power your weapons and demand they leave at once.

event.text: They shut off communications, but you can tell they have begun an evacuation procedure.

event.name: FILLER_CONFUSED_MANTIS
event.text: You receive a hail from a nearby civilian Engi vessel. Their Captain appears on your screen: "Strange bug. Can you assist in debugging?"
"Federation vessel has made fatal logic error. Virus != present. Bug refers to: insectoid. Problem-solving skills of squishy organics preferred to stringent Harmony protocols."

choice.text: Explain that you can't do any programming and leave.

event.text: The Engi try to convince you that you don't understand, but you insist and cease communications.

event.name: FILLER_CONFUSED_MANTIS_PROBLEM
event.text: "Found malfunctioning Free Mantis. Believes it is human. Will receive input only from human or fellow Free Mantis. Danger Evaluation: Extremely High. Provide assistance."

choice.text: Send a shuttle with an away team to help.
You have no one around to assist.
Leave them, a cornered Mantis is too dangerous.
(Human Crew) Send your human crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.

event.text: The Mantis is grateful to see 'another human', and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Send your Mantis crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.

event.text: The sight of a Free Mantis calms down the cornered insectoid, who introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Send your Mantis crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.

event.text: The Mantis is terrified at the sight of your crewmember. He lashes out, instantly killing your crew and turning on the Engi. You have no choice but to leave.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, dismemberment is one of the many cases your Clone Bay readily covers. That doesn't make it hurt any less, but your crew are probably used to it by now.

choice.text: (Hive Elite) Your elite Mantis is a natural leader. Send them in.

event.text: The Engi are visibly uncomfortable in the presence of your Mantis. They enter the room where the troublemaker is kept, and in a matter of minutes has slit their throat. When they return, they explain: "It was one of brainless Free Mantis types. Only solution was to kill." The Engi seem satisfied and pay you for your "efforts".

choice.text: (Mind Control) Use your Mind Control system to calm him down.

event.text: The Mantis calms down and communicates thanks to the Engi and yourself for helping. He requests to be dropped off at a nearby planet, at the human colony where he was raised. They are grateful for his return and offer a reward.

choice.text: (Mind Control Weapon) Use your Mind Control weapon to calm him down.

event.text: The Mantis calms down and communicates thanks to the Engi and yourself for helping. He requests to be dropped off at a nearby planet, at the human colony where he was raised. They are grateful for his return and offer a reward.

event.name: FILLER_CONFUSED_MANTIS_HOME
event.text: The colony is a mining operation that specializes in FTL fuel. Robert's family, the head engineers, are excited to see him, and are very grateful for his return. Apparently he ran away to 'join the Federation' like his older brother, but was never accepted onto a ship.

choice.text: Offer him a position on your ship.

event.text: He graciously accepts, having always wanted to serve in the Federation.

choice.text: Ask if they can take a look at your engines.

event.text: They are happy to take a look, and are able to offer some suggestions for improvements.
After an hour of convincing, the Mantis finally calms down and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.
The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. One of your crew is eviscerated before the rest are able to stop him. The Engi apologize for your loss.

removeCrew.text: Your crew's clone is waiting when you return to the ship.

event.text: The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. You're able to subdue him and leave him at a Mantis colony in a neighboring system. They don't seem pleased or grateful at his return.

event.name: FILLER_REFUGEE_NO_DISTRESS
event.text: Your sensors have picked up a refugee ship drifting through the system, no doubt one of many fleeing the Rebel advance. It doesn't appear to have detected you... or else it is trying to avoid notice.
You're wary of the refugees but figure it's safe to do something on the ship.

event.name: FILLER_CROPS
event.text: Scans show a remote settlement being blockaded by a pirate ship. The ship hastily messages you, "Stay out of this, or you'll be next!...Concentrate fire on..."
"You asked for it!" They pull away from the planet and move in to engage.
It's just not possible to save every civilian affected by this war. You prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Fire Weapon) Show the pirate how to intimidate settlers: burn their crops!

event.text: The pirate watches as you start to light the meager crops on fire. In a few moments the settlement surrenders, offering tribute to leave them alone. The pirate seems impressed.

choice.text: (Ballistic Fire Weapon) Show the pirate how to intimidate settlers: start fires in their crude dwellings. [-1}]

event.text: The pirate watches as you teleport an incendiary explosive into the settlement. As the settlers scramble to put out the fires, their rudimentary planetary defenses power down. Forcing their surrender was laughably easy, but the pirate seems impressed with your tactics and agrees to share the settlement's 'tribute'.

choice.text: (Particle Tech) Show the pirate how to intimidate settlers: burn their crops!

event.text: The pirate watches as you start to light the meager crops on fire. In a few moments the settlement surrenders, offering tribute to leave them alone. The pirate seems impressed.

event.name: PIRATE_STATION_CROPS_RESULT
event.text: With the pirates gone you signal the station. "We appreciate what you've done, but there'll just be another ship looking to profit from our isolation soon enough. Sorry we can't give you more."

event.name: FILLER_CLAIRVOYANT
event.text: The yellow ship at this beacon startles you, and you realise it's a Clairvoyant! You assume it must be lost, being so far away from a nebula.
The Slugs, confident in their ability to take you, make no attempt to get away and engage you directly in combat.
"Eugh... Federation... Yessss, we are lossst. No need to rub it in. We were chassssing ssssome filthy Fed- er.... criminalsss and wandered too far. Much too far. Could you ssspare ssssome fuel?"
The Slug quickly scoops up the fuel and brings it back to his ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug make the trade.

event.text: "One of ussss? My missstake... I did not think fellow Kleptocrianssss journeyed out thissss far intentionally..."
Knowing you have a Slug aboard your vessel, the Clairvoyants seem much more open, and you feel confident enough to accept their payment without suspecting some kind of trick.

choice.text: (Upg. Weapons) Keep your weapons powered while making the trade.

event.text: "I sssee you flexing your weaponssss over there, Feddy boy. You can put thossse away, I jusssst need the fuel..."
Knowing you're armed to the teeth, you doubt the Clairvoyants will try anything, and you feel confident enough to accept their payment without suspecting some kind of trick.
It's too risky approaching an Elite vessel like this.
"What unanticipated generosssity. You are now my favorite Fed. Don't let it go to your head though, you're ssstill lame." Despite the backhanded compliment, the Slug still pays you back.
"What unanticipated generosssity. You're asss much an idiot asss the lassst sssap we tricked like this! Prepare to die, Fed ssscum!"

event.name: FILLER_EXPLODED
event.text: A critically damaged civilian carryship is nearby. Scans show their life support is beyond non-functional, and they won't live long.

choice.text: Dock with the ship and save as many of the crew as you can.
(Lifeform Scanners) Run a scan on the ship, just to be certain.
(Upg. Sensors) Run a scan on the ship, just to be certain.
It's too late. We should just carry on.

event.text: There's no chance the civilians survived that explosion. You move on.
It appears the civilians didn't survive, though whether the lack of oxygen or the explosion was the culprit you aren't sure. You scrap what little remains of the ship and move on.
It appears only one civilian survived the explosion. They're grateful for your help and offer to serve on your ship.
You board the ship to find a gang of pirates onboard! They must have killed the civilians and accidentally destroyed the reactor.
It appears the civilians didn't survive, though whether the lack of oxygen or the explosion was the culprit you aren't sure. You scrap what little remains of the ship and move on.
It appears only one civilian survived the explosion. They're grateful for your help and offer to serve on your ship.
Scans show the ship is actually full of pirates, waiting to spring a trap when you board. You pull away from the wreck and fire upon their hull, frightening them. They immediately surrender.

event.name: FILLER_TIMER
event.text: You're hailed by a desperate civilian station. "Please, you have to help! Our scanners detect large asteroids approaching our station, but we're defenseless against them!"
You find the asteroids in question. You only have so much time until they hit the station.

choice.text: (Hull Armor) Block the asteroid with your vessel.

event.text: As the asteroid comes closer it's clear you won't get away as unscathed as you had hoped, but fortunately it's still recoverable. The station is grateful and offers a reward.

It only takes one shot from your weapon to blast the asteroid back into space, scattering tiny chunks in all directions as if it were made of glass. The civilians in the station cheer for your quick and easy success and reward you.
Too dangerous. We'll just wait for the FTL to charge.

event.name: CIVILIAN_ASTEROID_APPROACHING_WIN
event.text: "Thank you for your help! We'll have to make sure this won't happen in the future. But for now, here's payment for your help."

event.name: CIVILIAN_ASTEROID_APPROACHING_FAIL
event.text: You were not able to stop the asteroids in time. They smash into the civilian station, sending debris in every direction. Some of it hits your hull, causing minor damage.

choice.text: This is a great opportunity. Let's dock and see if we can find valuable supplies.
This is a huge risk. The AI advises against boarding the vessel.
We're in a hurry, let's just quickly pull some scrap off the ship.
Something is off here, let's just leave.

event.text: You ignore the abandoned wreck and fly away.

textList.name: TEXT_FILLER_GHOSTSHIP
textList.text: This beacon lies in an empty section of space. You almost move on before spotting a heavily damaged ship drifting nearby.
You share this beacon with just one other ship, but it appears long since abandoned.

Another ship is jumping away just as you arrive. They send out a quick communication before their jump completes: "That ruined bulk is more trouble than it's worth." You see a drifting, abandoned vessel nearby.
There's a heavily damaged ship at this beacon. You briefly pick up a very distorted communication from the ship but are unable to understand it. Your sensors detect no life-signs.

event.text: Your crew complains of hearing strange noises of static as they work. One requests that they end the salvage operation early.

choice.text: They're being ridiculous. Finish the job.
They've gathered enough supplies. Let's get going.
(Adv. Sensors) Wait, sensors are picking up something strange...

event.text: Your sensors are picking up some subtle but anomalous activity, it's as if the ship is slowly activating. You pull everyone back to your ship with what they have gathered.

event.name: FILLER_GHOSTSHIP_SCRAP
event.text: You recover what you can before making preparations to jump away.
Suddenly the wreckage powers up. Apparently this vessel was under control by Ghosts the entire time!

You receive a transmission from the ship, though it's entirely static. It's briefly followed by a message in plain text: "You got what you came for. Now leave us!" It appears this ship is merely inhabited by Vagabonds.

choice.text: Take the Ghost's advice and leave.
This ship could be dangerous to future travelers. We should destroy it.

event.text: You prepare to attack the Ghost vessel.
The salvage operation ends without a hitch. You get your crew-members back on board and prepare to jump away.

Just as they're finishing the salvage operation, your crew reports they're being attacked by what they claim to be the ghosts of the previous crew. You're concerned at first until you return to a sensible place of mind and remind yourself real ghosts don't exist. These must merely be the gaseous race nicknamed the Ghosts, known to inhabit wrecked vessels!

choice.text: Order your crew to retreat with what they can and get back to the ship.

event.text: Your crew make a hasty retreat, and manage to escape just before the ship fully powers up.

choice.text: Order them to stand their ground, they should be able to handle a few Ghosts.

event.text: The fight doesn't doesn't go well. Eventually your crew is forced to abandon the supplies and retreat of their own accord.
The Ghosts prove to be even weaker than you'd expected. Your crew quickly mops them up and brings back a large cache of supplies.
Your crew is losing the fight against the Ghosts. If this continues, you'll lose everyone.
Your crew safely make it back to the ship just in time as the grills activate and evaporate several of the Ghosts. The rest stand back, glaring at you as your ship pulls away.

choice.text: Retreat if possible, but protecting the ship is the primary goal.

event.text: You lose a crew-member to the fight but manage to escape the ghost ship and its inhabitants.

removeCrew.text: You get back to find your crew-member cloned, though annoyed with the command decisions that led to his death.

event.name: FILLER_GHOSTSHIP_BOARDED
event.text: The Ghosts follow your crew-members back on board the ship!

event.name: FILLER_ARGEONN_SALESMAN
event.text: A ship with conspicuous Argeonn markings is orbiting a nearby moon, broadcasting a simple message claiming to have equipment available for sale.

choice.text: Attack him before he can attack!

event.text: You raise your weapons and attack the pirate!
This seems far too sketchy to trust the offer. You ignore the smuggler.

event.name: CONTACT_PIRATE_SALESMAN
event.text: The ship responds: "Come in, under the banner of Argeonn I welcome you! I have many things, many things... would you care to take a look?"
As soon as you start to reverse your ship, the pirate reveals hidden weaponry and sets off in pursuit. You'll have to fight him to escape!

choice.text: (Slug Crew) "Sssir, we can dock, but I sssensse that we better plan on making a purchassse..."
(Hacking) Disable their Weapon system before docking.

event.text: You receive a hail as soon as your Hacking system finishes: "What have you done!? You can never trust a Federation ship! Here, take your 'standard toll'. I really should do business elsewhere, scum."

choice.text: (Targeting Jammer) Disable their Weapon system before docking.

event.text: You receive a hail as soon as your jamming takes effect: "What have you done!? You can never trust a Federation ship! Here, take your 'standard toll'. I really should do business elsewhere, scum."

event.name: DOCK_DRONE_SALESMAN
event.text: A human in an exquisite suit meets you on board. "Welcome to my ship! We specialize in drones of all kinds, can I interest you in any?"
"Many thanks for taking this off my hands! Just a word of advice... try not to let the authorities see you with it for another couple jumps."

"Ah, I'm sorry to hear that! Pleasant journeys." Once back to the helm, a series of explosions rocks your ship. The pirate ship has powered its weapons! You receive a message, "You shouldn't waste people's time Captain!"

choice.text: Move in to examine the station.

event.text: You decide it's not worth the time to examine.

textList.name: FILLER_EMPTY_STATION_TEXT
textList.text: You find a small space station that appears to abandoned.
You arrive to find what appears to be a colonized moon, however scans show it has been abandoned. You also detect an abandoned space station near the Beacon.
This area shows signs of a battle some time ago. There are scattered remains of ships but one station appears to be intact.

event.text: As you approach it becomes clear that the station is simply an empty shell. It has been stripped of useful materials long ago.
You approach cautiously but you detect no danger. It appears to have been a small rest stop that was abandoned a while ago. You take what few supplies you can find.
Upon closer inspection it appears to have a large portion of its hull destroyed. You take what few supplies you can find.
The station is in disarray. You find a cloning bay partially intact but nothing else seems to be functioning.

choice.text: (Clone Bay) Search for a surviving DNA bank.

event.text: While the cloning facilities are no longer functioning, you find someone was in queue to be cloned. You transfer their data to your Clone Bay, and after some time their body is rebuilt.
You take what you can and prepare to move on.
You dock with the station to take a look inside. However no sooner do you open the airlock than pirates burst in. Meanwhile scanners pick up a previously undetected pirate ship moving in to attack!

You dock with the station to take a look inside. However no sooner do you open the airlock than pirates burst in. Meanwhile multiple warning signals go off on the bridge. The pirates have activated a remote planetary defense system and it's locking onto your ship!
The clone is extremely confused but calms down after you try to explain the situation. With no other options the clone offers to work on your ship for a time.
The clone is extremely confused but seems to accept their new situation. With no other options the clone offers to work on your ship for a time.
The clone emerges in a crazed frenzy and refuses to calm down. You have no choice but to fight.

textList.name: FILLER_REBEL_CHECKPOINT_TEXT
textList.text: It looks like this Beacon is home to a Rebel checkpoint. They're stopping and searching any ship that passes through. Civilians are being harassed, and Federation members are detained. The Rebels haven't noticed you yet.
Another Rebel checkpoint is monitoring this location. A number of civilian ships are awaiting inspection, any of them could be Federation loyalists. The Rebels haven't noticed you yet.

A Rebel space station and single fighter is monitoring this Beacon for Federation activity. A number of civilian ships are docked, awaiting inspection by the Rebels and possible detainment if they are Federation loyalists. The Rebels haven't noticed you yet.
A rather large fleet of civilian ships are held up at this Beacon. It appears to be a Rebel checkpoint; everyone is being inspected for possible ties to the Federation. No one has noticed you yet.

textList.name: FILLER_REBEL_BRIBE_TEXT
textList.text: These Rebels are easily swayed by the prospect of additional scrap. They release the civilian ships and everyone is free to go.
Like most Rebels, these are just men trying to get by in a rough galaxy. They take your scrap and let everyone continue their journeys.
As everyone currently awaiting inspection is human anyway, the Rebels let them go. They take your scrap and tell you to hurry along.
They eagerly accept your bribe, obviously revolutionaries are under paid. The civilian ships all begin to jump away.

textList.name: GENERIC_HIDE_TEXT
textList.text: Fly behind a moon and stay hidden.
Shut down all non-vital systems and stay hidden.
Stay quiet and hope they don't notice you.
Stay out of their way and charge your FTL drive.

choice.text: Fend for yourself, attack and escape.

event.text: You move in to attack the Rebel ship.

choice.text: Bribe the Rebels to release the civilian ships.
(MFK Ace Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel ship.

event.text: Rebel forces are bloated with washups, conscripts, or disheartened officers who are only in its ranks because their reality was conquered by Rebels first. The Rebel running the checkpoint barely even glances at your MFK Ace's outdated Rebel ID before deciding to let you past.

choice.text: Take a chance and request they free some civilians.

event.text: At first the Rebels don't buy it, but you manage to pull some trickery to convince them that several of the civilians were cleared for release. The officer in charge is satisfied with this at first while you start taking civilians on board, but eventually grows impatient and decides he's had enough of your ruse.

choice.text: Take this chance to do something aboard the ship.
(Engineer Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel ship.

event.text: Rebel forces are bloated with washups, conscripts, or disheartened officers who are only in its ranks because their reality was conquered by Rebels first. The Rebel running the checkpoint barely even glances at your Engineer's outdated Rebel ID before deciding to let you past.

choice.text: Take a chance and request they free some civilians.

event.text: At first the Rebels don't buy it, but you manage to pull some trickery to convince them that several of the civilians were cleared for release. The officer in charge is satisfied with this at first while you start taking civilians on board, but eventually grows impatient and decides he's had enough of your ruse.

choice.text: Take this chance to do something aboard the ship.

event.text: The civilians are grateful. However, none of them seem eager to be mistaken as Federation loyalists so they quickly jump away.
Some of the civilians pool together their excess scrap to try to repay you for your help.
One of the civilian ships quietly teleports over a crate of Federation military supplies.
One of the civilian ships contacts you and reveals they are Federation loyalists. An eavesdropping Rebel swoops in, destroys the ship, and turns to attack you!

textList.name: FILLER_REBEL_HELPERS_TEXT
textList.text: You stumble across a Rebel ship distributing supplies to local civilian colonies. It's probably not anything military grade, but every little bit helps...
You find a Rebel combat ship that has been reassigned as an emergency supply vessel. The local civilians are apparently in need of help, and the Rebels are rising to the occasion.
The Rebels in this system are doing supply runs for the local space stations. These civilians have likely been out of supply for months due to the war and are in desperate need.
Civilian colonists loyal to the Rebel cause are present on a nearby planet. It looks like they are currently receiving a supply shipment. Could be useful.

Because of the war, thousands of colonists have had their supply lines disrupted and have found themselves in dire straits. It seems in this system, the Rebels are sympathetic and are distributing what little supplies they can spare.

textList.name: FILLER_REBEL_HELPER_NO_SUPPLIES_TEXT
textList.text: You make to preparations to leave. One of the civilian leaders contacts you: "That Rebel was our sole source of supplies. You have doomed us all."
You leave the civilians with the supplies, though without the Rebel that was running supplies to them its unlikely they'll live long.
You wonder if any more Rebels will be available to help these civilians on the edge of nowhere. Oh well, for you a few more dead Rebels matter more than the lives of a thousand colonists.

Before your FTL drive charges, you receive a hail: "My son was on that ship. He only helped the Rebels because they cared enough to help us. Without him to find us supplies, we'll likely be forgotten and die out here."

event.text: You engage the Rebel ship.

choice.text: (MFK Ace Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel ship and deliver the supplies yourself.

event.text: "Oh, are you the one command sent to start making these deliveries? Great, take these and bring them down there to those colonists. They'll be waiting for you."

You fly down to the planet surface where you drop off the supplies. The colonists are confused as they don't recognize you, but they're glad for the help and offer some repairs and some work on your weapons system.

choice.text: Wait and steal the supplies from the civilians.

event.text: You decide not to bother the Rebels.

The colonists hand over the supplies. It appears to be mostly equipment meant for automated farming, but you can make use of it. As you leave, you receive a message: "This is why the Rebels will always have support!"
The colonists hand over the supplies and you load it onto your ship. As you jump away, you crack it open and discover nothing more than vaccinations for a local plague.
You make the colonists teleport the supplies to your ship. It's nothing more than building construction supplies. Oh well, scrap is scrap.
The colonists willingly give up their supplies. But as you make to jump away, an explosion rocks your ship. The cargo was booby trapped!
The colonists hand over the supplies. It appears to be nothing more than some basic medical supplies.
The colonists hand over the supplies. It appears to be a small supply of ammunition, probably for their mining operations.
The colonists aren't willing to give up the supplies without a fight. As you bring the cargo back to your ship, a horde of angry civilians board and try to take it back!
It appears the supplies are mostly equipment meant for automated farming, but you can make use of it. As you leave, you receive a message: "This is why the Rebels will always have support!"
The supplies are nothing more than building construction supplies. Oh well, scrap is scrap.
It appears the supplies are nothing more than some basic medical supplies.
It appears the supplies are a small supply of ammunition, probably for their mining operations.

textList.name: FILLER_ROGUE_REBEL_TEXT
textList.text: You arrive at a beacon located in a civilian star system. A nearby colony contacts you: "We've got a rogue Rebel ship harassing this system. Do you have time to find it?"
As soon as you arrive, you receive a Federation encrypted message: A Rebel ship has been terrorizing the local civilians in this system, please seek and destroy it.
You begin charging your FTL drive, and do a quick scan of a local planet. You find the ruins of a recently destroyed Federation colony of the surface. There must be a Rebel ship in the vicinity...

You jump into a field of debris. It appears a battle recently took place here, and the loser seems to have been a civilian ship. A message was left on repeat before it was destroyed: "Rebels attacking, please send aid!" The responsible Rebels are likely still nearby.

choice.text: Go looking for the Rebel ship.
No time to search, you prepare to jump away.

event.text: You decide not to go hunting for Rebels.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Perform a scan of the area.

event.text: You quickly find the Rebel ship's location and move to intercept.
You find the Rebel ship hiding on a nearby asteroid. You are able to get a shot off and permanently disable their engines before they notice you.
You find the Rebel ship hiding on a nearby asteroid. You are able to get a shot off and permanently disable their engines before they notice you.
You spend some time looking around but your scanners cannot pick up any trace of the Rebel ship.
After far too much time spent searching, you are finally able to track him down. You go into the fight pondering just how much of a head start you've lost on the Rebel Fleet...
After a short search you find the Rebel ship. Let's hope he's as easy to defeat in combat as he was to find.

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_ABANDONED
event.text: You have encountered a refugee ship drifting in space. It looks as if it was fleeing the Rebel advance and ran out of fuel. Its distress beacon is active, but you're not sure anyone is on board, and its communications seem to be down.

choice.text: Unless you desire to be ambushed by a threat, you're not going out there on your own.
(Boarding Drone) Use a drone to investigate.

event.text: You don't take chances with ghost ships.
The ship is completely abandoned. There is no trace of the crew or any cargo. Mystified, you leave the ghost ship and continue on.

The ship is completely abandoned. It looks like it ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, you are able to scavenge some supplies from the cargo hold.

It looks as if the ship ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, you find one surviving crewman locked in the freezer, almost perfectly preserved and apparently overlooked by the starving crew.

As you investigate the ship, you are attacked by the now-cannibalistic crew! Driven mad by lack of food, they have turned to feeding on each other. As you fight your way off the ship, one of your crew falls to the crazed attackers, and you are forced to leave them behind or else lose your entire ship.

removeCrew.text: Your abandoned crewmember is waiting on the ship when you return, trying not to dwell on the fate of his previous incarnation.

event.text: As you approach the ship, your sensors flicker off for a second and you realise you have been boarded by Ghosts!
The ship is completely abandoned. There is no trace of the crew or any cargo. Mystified, you leave the ghost ship and continue on.

The ship is completely abandoned. It looks like it ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, you are able to scavenge some supplies from the cargo hold.

It looks as if the ship ran out of fuel... and the crew ran out of food not long after. Despite the grisly scene that remains, your drone finds one surviving crewman locked in the freezer, almost perfectly preserved and apparently overlooked by the starving crew.

As your drone investigates the ship, it is attacked by the now-cannibalistic crew! Driven mad by lack of food, they have turned to feeding on each other. You are forced to leave the drone behind or else lose your entire ship.
As you approach the ship, your sensors flicker off for a second and you realise you have been boarded by Ghosts!

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_REFUGEE
event.text: You have encountered a refugee ship drifting in space. It looks as if it was fleeing the Rebel advance and ran out of fuel. Its distress beacon is active, but you're not sure anyone is on board.
You're wary of the refugees but figure it's safe to do something on the ship.
As you hail the freighter, it advances, weapons bristling from its hull! It's a pirate ambush!

As you hail the refugee ship, a Zoltan ship suddenly jumps into the system... it claims the refugees are criminals, and accuses you of escorting fugitives! Before you can respond, it cuts communications, and powers up its weapons!
As you hail the refugee ship, a pirate ship jumps into the system... it was using the refugee ship as bait!
As you hail the refugee ship, a Slug ship jumps into the system... it was hunting the refugee ship for sport and now they've found you instead!
As you hail the refugee ship, a Duskbringer ship jumps into the system... they've decided to test their weapons on some humans and these poor civilians found their way into their cross-hairs!

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_DISEASE
event.text: You locate a nearby human mining colony where an unknown disease has spread virulently. They are setting up a quarantine to contain it but a riot has broken out.

choice.text: Send in your crew to help control the crowds.
Your vessel currently lacks the manpower required to handle a crowd.
Ignore their request and move on.

event.text: Unfortunately your mission is too important and you're not willing to risk your crew. You prepare to move on.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Send your Rock crew-member to prevent a riot.

event.text: It's unlikely the Rock's impressive immune system is susceptible to a human virus so you send it in. It is able to intimidate the workers long enough for the colony forces to set up a quarantine. Their leaders offer a reward and assure you they will try to find a cure as soon as possible.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Send your Engi to calm down the infected.

event.text: With no fear of catching the disease, your Engi crewmember helps reassure and organize the infected humans. Calmed by its extensive knowledge of human physiology, the infected submit to the quarantine in the hopes that a cure can be found soon. The colony leaders offer a reward for helping to prevent an ugly incident.

choice.text: (Ghost Crew) Send your Ghost to calm down the infected.

event.text: Because of your Ghost's gaseous nature, they have little fear of catching the disease. However, rather than calming the crowds, your Ghost sends them into even greater panic. Assuming the entity is an omen of death, it takes some time for your Ghost to reinstate order. Going along with the crowd, they play with that idea, affirming to the colonists that if they do not listen to their leaders, he will return to reap their souls. This is surprisingly effective, and you're paid for your help.

choice.text: (Obelisk Crew) Send your Obelisk to calm down the infected.

event.text: The rioters are silenced by the strange box shaped figure. Thoroughly distracted by the foreign creature, the crowd does not notice the riot control is able to sneak in and neutralize the rioters. The law enforcement offers a reward for your troubles, as well as your effective methods resulting in no lives lost.

choice.text: (Medical Drone) Send your drone to treat the infected. [-1|]

event.text: Being highly advanced and designed for situations like these, your drone moves through the crowds, dispensing tissues and lolipops, and administering a "treatment" of pure water. The crowd is thoroughly convinced that this has actually helped them, and returns back to their homes. The law enforcement thanks you.

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Send your crew to treat the infected.

event.text: Knowing just how to handle this, your medic dons a mask and moves about administering a "treatment" of pure water. The crowd is thoroughly convinced that this has actually helped them, and returns back to their homes. The law enforcement thanks you.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Use your Medbay to help synthesize a cure.

event.text: Your military-grade medical computers are easily able to isolate the cause of the virus, a previously unknown spore that was unearthed during excavations. You are quickly able to inform the colony's leaders of your success in reverse engineering a cure.
"Thank you so much! We don't have the funds to hire outside help and it would have taken our staff weeks to figure that out. Here, take this as payment!"

choice.text: (Med-bot Dispersal) Use the Nano med-bots to accelerate the dispersal of the cure.

event.text: You reconfigure your ship's Nano dispersal system. In a matter of minutes all of the workers are cured. The leaders can hardly believe what you have achieved. They offer you what they can as payment.

Your crew tries to keep the crowds in line but the scene quickly turns ugly. Half-crazed with fear, the infected grab mining tools and push back at your crew, forcing them to retreat hastily. They barely get away without injury but the same can't be said for the colony's leaders. You quickly leave.

With the visible threat of your weapons, the infected become subdued enough for you to set up a rudimentary quarantine. However before you leave, one of your crew presents signs of infection. You have no choice but to leave them on the station in the hopes that they discover a cure quickly. You leave before more crew succumb.

removeCrew.text: As your crewman is still alive and working towards a cure, it would be against Federation regulation to create a clone to continue with you on your journey.

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_FIRE
event.text: You find the source of the distress call, a small research station. It appears a small laboratory fire got out of control and is threatening to destroy the station. Their fire suppression system is not responding.

choice.text: Send your crew in a shuttle to help put out the fire.
You have no one aboard to handle a station-wide fire.
Dock and try to rescue the survivors.

event.text: You coldly shut off communications and prepare to leave. Your crew seems upset but you assure them that nothing could have been done.
You coldly shut off communications and prepare to leave. You're upset about the situation, but the ship AI assures you that nothing could have been done.

Your crew tears through the airlock directly into the fire. You've never seen someone move that fast. It disperses as much fire suppressant as possible into the heart of the blaze and eventually the fires start to die down.
With most of the fire under control, the scientists are able to help secure the station. They offer you their sincere gratitude and a generous reward.

choice.text: (Elite Crew) Send your elite crew-member in.

event.text: Your crew, armed with years of elite training for situations like this, finds their way into the station and begins to suppress the fire.
With most of the fire under control, the scientists are able to help secure the station. They offer you their sincere gratitude and a generous reward.

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Send your Repair drone into the fire.

event.text: You send the Repair drone in and it methodically puts out the fires. Once it has made some progress, the rest of your crew helps to secure the station.
They offer you their sincere gratitude; the station would have surely been destroyed without your assistance. They transfer a small reward and an additional drone schematic.

choice.text: (Extinguishers) Use your tech to suppress the fire.

event.text: You quickly grab some extra extinguishers from the storage and attach a hose to the suppression system, then move through the station, putting out the larger fires.
They offer you their sincere gratitude; the station would have surely been destroyed without your assistance. They transfer a small reward and an additional drone schematic.

You send your crew into the station. Unfortunately as soon as they enter the fire breaches the station's fuel cell containment. You quickly try to dock and retrieve your crew but not before an unfortunate soul is lost in the inferno.

removeCrew.text: With a new-found respect for flames, your crewmember's clone stumbles out of the Clone Bay.

event.text: Your crew valiantly keeps the fire at bay long enough to allow some of the scientists to escape, but it appears to be a losing battle. Before long you order the retreat. The few scientists they were able to save are distraught but grateful. You'll drop them off at the next station.

You locate the highest concentration of life forms and bring the ship alongside the station. Before you can begin to offload the survivors, a huge blast splits the station apart. Your ship is thrown away and some debris pierces your hull. You watch helplessly as the last of the survivors are consumed in the collapse of the station.

You pull up alongside the station and cut through their hull. You are able to rescue a few survivors but many more are lost. One of the survivors offers to join your crew and you offload the rest on a nearby station.

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_SATELLITE
event.text: The distress signal is coming from a small space station orbiting an uninhabited planet. Their satellite defense system has gone haywire and their repair crew can't approach without being fired on. They're looking for help to fix or disable it.
You consider your options.

choice.text: Simply fire on the defense system from a distance.

event.text: You use your ion weaponry to disable the gun long enough for their repair crews to fix it. They message you, "I've never seen a weapon like that before! Thanks for your help. Please accept this reward."
Your Energy weapon ends up causing more damage to the defense system instead of ionizing it. No one was harmed but they don't seem happy with your solution.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Use your Cloaking to disable the system.

event.text: You use your ship's Cloaking to try to prevent the defense system from getting a lock. However before you are able to safely disable the system your cloaking gives out and you are forced to destroy the satellite. No one was harmed but they don't seem happy with your solution.

choice.text: (Upg. Cloaking) Use your Cloaking to disable the system.

event.text: You use your ships Cloaking to prevent the defense system from getting a lock. Once closer, you hasten to disable the system without damaging it. It was a sloppy job but they appreciate it and offer a reward.

choice.text: (Adv. Cloaking) Use your Cloaking to disable the system.

event.text: Your ship's Advanced Cloaking allows you to approach the defense system without an issue. Once closer, you are able to safely disable the system. They thank you for your help and offer a reward.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Remotely repair its targeting system.

event.text: Your crew-member is able to remotely fix the glitch in the defense AI, allowing the repair crew to close in and finish the job. The station gives you its thanks along with a reward.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Remotely repair its targeting system.

event.text: Your crew-member is able to remotely fix the glitch in the defense AI, allowing the repair crew to close in and finish the job. The station gives you its thanks along with a reward.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew) Your crew offers to help.

event.text: Your Lanius crewman appears to have a solution. The Lanius simply jumps out of the airlock towards the satellite. Apparently its lack of heat signatures renders it hidden from the satellite's targeting sensors. Once there he simply melts it down into scrap. You quickly pick him up and prepare to jump before the station can question your methods.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Block the satellite's targeting capabilities.

event.text: With the satellite unable to lock onto anything, the repair crew move in and finish the job. The station gives you its thanks along with a reward.
You can't help them so you prepare to move on.

You fire a few volleys from a distance and it is clear the defense system is no match for your weapons. However, the station does not seem happy with your 'solution'. You salvage what you can and jump before there is trouble.

You fire a few volleys but aren't able to penetrate the defense system's shields. Its weapons have no trouble piercing yours though, and you take minor damage before escaping. The station will need to find help elsewhere.

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_MINER
event.text: You arrive at the distress beacon near a small asteroid belt and find a ship with pirate markings partially crushed between two large rocks. It must have been illegally mining the belt without proper equipment.

choice.text: Try to dislodge the ship by shooting at the rocks.
Destroy and loot the ship. They're just pirates.
(Damaging Beam Weapon) Carefully cut the ship out.

event.text: You use your beam to make a few precision cuts in the asteroid. The ship gives a quick burst of thrust and the rock crumbles away. They thank you and offer some of the resources they have collected.

choice.text: (Damaging Pinpoint Weapon) Attempt to meticulously cut out the pirate ship.

event.text: In a rather baffling decision to the rest of your crew, you take the increduously long time to chip away at the asteroid with your Pinpoint. You're certain the fleet has caught up by now and you've barely made any impact, giving you no choice but to abandon the pirate ship.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Have your drone cut the ship out.

event.text: You program the drone to work carefully around the trapped ship. In a short time it allows the ship to easily slip out of its cage. They thank you and offer some of the resources they have collected.

You take a few careful shots but you expose a mineral patch in the rock that reacts violently with your weapon. A shockwave forces you back as debris pelts against your hull. When you regain control you find there is not much left of the ship.
You fire a few volleys into the rock and it starts to shudder and break apart. Without shields the pirate ship takes a beating but eventually pulls free. They thank you for your assistance.
You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull causing the ship to depressurize and break apart. You move in to loot the remains.

You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull. Before you can scrap the remains another pirate ship flashes on your radar. Perhaps they saw your deed, or perhaps they want to claim the spoils for themselves, but for whatever reason, they're charging weapons!

event.name: FILLER_DISTRESS_ESCORT
event.text: Once you arrive at the location of the distress call a civilian ship hails you, "Thanks for responding to our beacon. Our FTL navigation has gone haywire and we can't plot a course to the nearest depot to get it fixed. Could you lead us there?"
"Take this bit of scrap as a down-payment. We'll use your jump signatures to follow you. You're really helping us out here."
"Alright... If you're not going that way I guess it can't be helped. We'll just wait for the next ship to come."
The civilians are shocked by your sudden hostility, but have no chance to escape.

choice.text: (Advanced Navigation) Have your navigation software calculate and upload route instructions to their ship.

event.text: "We're receiving your transmission... Wow, I didn't know that chain-jumping was possible with this class of ship. We'll get back in a single jump! Thank you so much, please accept this."
You power up your weapons and engage the Rebel ship.

choice.text: (Targeting Jammer) Disable the Rebel weapons so the Fed ship can escape.

event.text: Your targeting jammer locks onto the Rebel's systems, shutting their weapons offline. Still not having seen you, the Rebels struggle to get their weapons back while you slip away to the other side of the system with the Federation ship you saved.

choice.text: (Flares) Use the flares to make a distraction so the Fed ship can escape.

event.text: A confident shot from the flare dispenser launches the small disc right onto the visor of the Rebel vessel, temporarily blinding and distracting the captain. The Federation vessel escapes with you to the other side of the system.
The Rebel's preoccupation with the Federation ship allows you to slip away undetected. However you can't help but feel you should have helped them.

textList.name: TEXT_FILLER_DISTRESS_COMBAT
textList.text: Upon arriving at this beacon, you detect a distress call. Local scans reveal that a Federation transport is under attack from a Rebel scout!

You immediately notice a Rebel ship chasing what appears to be a civilian transport. However you are detecting chatter on an encrypted Federation channel... That transport is carrying Federation loyalists!
